alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 07 at 4:17PM CDT until July 10 at 9:14AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Mid Fork Salt River near Holliday. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mid Fork Salt River near Holliday. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Wastewater lift station begins flooding at about this height. Water was 16 ft deep in July 2008. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM CDT Thursday was 18.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Mid Fork Salt River Holliday 17.0 18.4 20.2 17.1 8.1 5.5 4.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
